title: Augusta County: James R. McCutchan [?] to Rachel Ann McCutchan, June 28, 1861
summary: In this letter, McCutchan lists the towns his company has marched through in northern Virginia near Harper's Ferry, and he describes their current camp at the Virginia-Maryland border, just across from Union troops. He also writes of the town of Martinsburg and the military hospital there.
keywords: Death/Casualties, Home Front, Medicine/Hospitals, Patriotism, Troop Movement, Women, American Civil War
